revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=WNDR4500 |revision=v1 |series=N900 |upc=606449077360 |asin=B005KG44V0 |is_manuf=No |manuf=Foxconn |manuf_model=U12H189 |manuf_rev=T00 |price=180 |est_release_date=09/14/2011 |fcc_date=07/29/2011 |fcc_id=PY311200162 |ic_id=4054A-11200162 |pcb_id=U12H189T00 |type=wireless router, print server |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4706 |cpu1_cspeed=600 |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=Samsung |fla1_model=K9F1G08U0D-SCB0 |fla2=2 |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4T51163Q1-HCE6 |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=2 |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4331 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM4331 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_cpu=yes |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM53115 |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=1GbE |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE2605L;SiGe, 2605L, 151AJ;3;,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE5003L1;5003L1, 142AU;3; |tp_firmware=DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT, FreshTomato |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid=NETGEARXX, NETGEARXX-5G |default_ssid_regex=^NETGEAR[0-9]{2}$,,, ^NETGEAR[0-9]{2}-5G$ |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=password |oui=20:4E:7F, 74:44:01, 84:1B:5E, E0:46:9A |oui_eth=20:4E:7F, 74:44:01, 84:1B:5E, E0:46:9A }} {{TagLine|N900 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router}} :[http://www.netgear.com/home/products/wirelessrouters/ultimate-performance/WNDR4500.aspx Product page] {{SupportPage|vendor=NETGEAR|model=WNDR4500|vs_id=19413}} Manuf. by [[Foxconn]] (Hon Hai) (per [http://www.downloads.netgear.com/files/WNDR4500-V1.0.0.40_1.0.10.chk this firmware file], the internal model :is probably U12H189 [U12H189T00], file is nearly 8MB) The source code for the device is available on [ftp://downloads.netgear.com/files/GPL/ Netgear's FTP server]. :Each wireless interface has three U.FL connectors. The BCM4706 has a MIPS32 74K core and identifies as a BCM5300. The default SSIDs appear to be '''NETGEARXX''' and '''NETGEARXX-5G''' :where '''XX''' is a number. *{{TechInfoDepot|Netgear_WNDR4500v1}} ===Links=== *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?pid=149569 On the '''OpenWrt''' forums] *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/netgear/wndr4500 On the '''OpenWrt''' wiki] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=145503&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=0 On the '''DD-WRT''' forums] *[http://tomatousb.org/forum/t-412488 On the '''TomatoUSB''' forums] *[http://www.myopenrouter.com/download/38649/DD-WRT-for-NETGEAR-WNDR4500-Initial-Release/ ''Tathagata Das''' initial DD-WRT build for this router] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=155601 and discussion of this build on the '''DD-WRT''' forums] This router is sold by ''Costco'' as the ''R4500'' (OUI 84:1B:5E). :[http://kb.netgear.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/22235 The Readyshare Cloud and Apple's Time Machine
are not supported on the R4500]. ===Reviews=== *[https://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31603-netgear-wndr4500-n900-wireless-dual-band-gigabit-router-reviewed Reviewed on SmallNetBuilder] and [https://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31621-netgear-wndr4500-retest retested] *[http://www.maximumpc.com/article/reviews/netgear_wndr4500_wi-fi_router_review Reviewed on MaximumPC] *[http://www.slashgear.com/netgear-wndr4500-review-14178914/ Reviewed on SlashGear] *[http://reviews.cnet.com/routers/netgear-wndr4500-n900-wireless/4505-3319_7-35017823.html Reviewed on CNet] *[http://www.foxnetwork.ru/index.php/en/component/content/article/120-netgear-wndr4500.html Reviewed on FoxNetwork] *[http://openlinksys.info/forum/viewthread.php?thread_id=14238 Reviewed by shibby (PL)], *[http://translate.google.pl/translate?sl=pl&tl=en&js=n&prev=_t&hl=pl&ie=UTF-8&layout=2&eotf=1&u=http%3A%2F%2Fopenlinksys.info%2Fforum%2Fviewthread.php%3Fthread_id%3D14238 in English] :Dual Flash, 2MB and 128MB NAND (74:44:01 OUI) :NETGEAR and NETGEAR-5G SSIDs, not NETGEARXX(-5G) ==Images== All pictures are from [http://www.netgear.fr/presse/photos.php?prod=WNDR4500 Netgear France].
